vehicles.description: One black car driving ahead in the same lane as the ego car, maintaining a straight trajectory.
vehicles.explanation: The ego car must keep a safe distance from this vehicle to prevent any collisions, especially in case of sudden braking or other unforeseen actions from the vehicle ahead.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Multiple pedestrians are visible on both sides of the streets, some closer to the roadway edge on the right side, which may indicate potential road crossing.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The presence of pedestrians near the roadway edge requires the ego car to be ready to slow down or stop to give way, ensuring pedestrian safety.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Sanitation workers on the right side of the road, close to the vehicle's pathway, potentially moving into the roadway for operational reasons.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: The workers create an unpredictable element requiring the ego car to reduce speed and proceed with heightened alertness.

traffic signs.description: A no-entry sign is visible on the right side of the road, indicating a restriction for vehicles entering that lane.
traffic signs.explanation: The ego car must not enter the lane where the no-entry sign is posted, which informs the route planning of the vehicle to stay on the correct path.

traffic cones.description: Orange traffic cones line the right side of the road, marking out a section likely for work being done.
traffic cones.explanation: Cones usually indicate areas to avoid, guiding the ego car to stay in its lane and potentially signaling a narrowed path due to the roadside work.

barriers.description: White and red striped poles are intermittently placed on the left edge of the street, separating the sidewalk from the road.
barriers.explanation: The poles signify the boundary of the driving area and ensure that the ego car maintains a safe distance from the curb and pedestrian path.

suggestions: The ego vehicle should maintain a safe following distance from the SUV ahead, be prepared to react to pedestrian movements, especially from the right side where workers are present, and comply with the no-entry traffic sign by not turning into the restricted lane. The ego car should also monitor the delineated pathway defined by the traffic bollards and be prepared to take evasive actions if necessary while maintaining a safe speed to respond to any unexpected pedestrian or worker movements.
